Models

Treat EV Batteries at End-of-Life
  • Decomposition
  • ICOM

Activity: Check Battery Management System

Description

Notes:

Definitions:
See A3142.

Standards:
IEC 62133-2:2017, Secondary cells and batteries containing alkaline or other non-acid electrolytes - Safety requirements for portable sealed secondary cells, and for batteries made from them, for use in portable applications - Part 2: Lithium systems

UL 1974, Evaluation for Repurposing or Remanufacturing Batteries

UL 1642, Certification of Lithium-ion Battery

ISO 12405-1:2011, Electrically propelled road vehicles - Test specification for lithium-ion traction battery packs and systems - Part 1: High-power applications

References:
Chung, H. C. (2021). Charge and discharge profiles of repurposed LiFePO4 batteries based on the UL 1974 standard. Scientific data, 8(1), 165.

Kehl, D., Jennert, T., Lienesch, F., & Kurrat, M. (2021). Electrical characterization of Li-ion battery modules for second-life applications. Batteries, 7(2), 32.

Michelini, E., Höschele, P., Abbas, S. M., Ellersdorfer, C., & Moser, J. (2023). Assessment of health indicators to detect the aging state of commercial second-life lithium-ion battery cells through basic electrochemical cycling. Batteries, 9(11), 542.

Murphy, L., & Crawford, C. (2025). Data-driven classification of lithium-ion batteries for second-life applications. Journal of Energy Storage, 133, 117994.

Svensson, D., & Särnevång, A. (2024). Inspection and Evaluation Method to Repurpose Used Batteries.

Usage List:

  • Appears as Check Battery Management System in Diagram A31: Repurpose in in Treat EV Batteries at End-of-Life .
